metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2105 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the EVP_EncodeUpdate function in crypto/evp/encode.c inOpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a large amount ofbinary data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2105` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
